greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number T(n,k) of set partitions of [n] into exactly k blocks where sizes of distinct blocks are coprime; triangle T(n,k), n>=0, 0<=k<=n, read by rows.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..200, flattened
maple: b:= proc(n, i, s) option remember; expand(
`if`(n=0 or i=1, x^n, b(n, i-1, select(x->x<=i-1, s))+
`if`(i>n or factorset(i) intersect s<>{}, 0, x*b(n-i, i-1,
T:= n-> (p-> seq(coeff(p, x, i), i=0..degree(p)))(b(n$2, {})):
mathematica: b[n_, i_, s_] := b[n, i, s] = Expand[If[n == 0 || i == 1, x^n, b[n, i - 1, Select[s, # <= i - 1 &]] + If[i > n || FactorInteger[i][[All, 1]]  ~Intersection~ s != {}, 0, x*b[n - i, i - 1, Select[ s ~Union~ FactorInteger[i][[All, 1]], # <= i - 1 &]]*Binomial[n, i]]]]; T[n_] := Function [p, Table[Coefficient[p, x, i], {i, 0, Exponent[p, x]}]][b[n, n, {}]]; Table[T[n], {n, 0, 12}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 20 2017, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Jan 09 2017
